meeting_summary: The board approved routine items including fire equipment and fireworks contracts, but saw significant public debate over a Gaza humanitarian crisis resolution. Motion 'd' regarding Gaza ultimately failed, leading to an amended alternative resolution that passed with mixed votes.

votes.motion_description: Minutes of the 7/21/25 Special Meeting/Workshop be approved
Minutes of the 7/28/25 meeting be approved

Kim Anderson be granted permission to conduct a 'Peaceful Public Assembly' in support of democracy on 8/30/2025 from 11:00am to 3:00pm on the sidewalks at the Milton Avenue/Front Street intersection, and to gather in Wiswall Park for announcements and live music
votes.notes: Event form for park portion of this motion and proof of insurance pending

votes.motion_description: Eagle-Matt Lee Fire Co. #1 be authorized to purchase 650 feet of hose at a cost of $4,862.00

Approving the contracts between Santore Firework and the Village of Ballston Spa for a fireworks display at the Saratoga County Fairgrounds on 8/17/2025 for Family Fun Day for an aggregate value of $6,000.00, and authorizing the Mayor to execute the contracts
votes.notes: Proof of insurance has been provided, and donations have been received to cover the cost

votes.motion_description: To adopt the attached resolution on the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, post the resolution on the village web site, and mail to New York Senators Schumer and Gillibrand, Congressperson Tonko, and President Trump on village letterhead

discussion.speaker: Ms. Frankewich
discussion.statement: shared her thoughts on the resolution

discussion.speaker: Ms. Iacolucci
discussion.statement: feels the resolution is fine but doesn't address the urgent humanitarian crisis

discussion.speaker: Mr. DuBuque
discussion.statement: stated there are a lot of people out there that are passionate about humanitarian aid

discussion.speaker: Ellie Dillon
discussion.statement: feels if we don't speak out, we are compliant

discussion.speaker: Trustee Raymond
discussion.statement: feels we should send this resolution and request that our representatives fund programs to benefit disenfranchised people

discussion.speaker: Trustee Baskin
discussion.statement: stated he will abstain because the resolution does not condemn the Israeli government

discussion.speaker: Trustee Raymond
discussion.statement: would like the resolution to be more specific

votes.notes: Board members will be working with Trustee Baskin over the weekend to potentially revise his resolution and this motion

votes.motion_description: Amending the resolution read by Trustee VanDeinse-Perez
votes.notes: Alternative resolution to the failed Motion 6

votes.motion_description: Village of Ballston Spa DPW be granted permission to purchase a TARCO Leaf Collection Box with Flexible Connector for $11,184.00
votes.notes: This was previously anticipated in the FY2026 Budget

votes.motion_description: Approving the in-Village water connection for 105 Fairground Avenue
votes.notes: The connection has been approved by Labella Engineering and the Village Water Department

votes.motion_description: Approving the agreement between Delaware Engineering and the Village of Ballston Spa approving the not to exceed $12,5000.00 related to work to devise a concept plan/needs assessment for the DPW garage replacement
Village of Ballston Spa be authorized to get tree work done on all the trees between Prospect Street and East High Street by Earth Care Plus for a total not to exceed $5,000.00
votes.notes: This work includes removal, trimming and stump grinding

votes.motion_description: Approve no more than $400.00 in checks to be issued for reimbursements related to the Swimming Under the Stars event for food and other items that were purchased

discussion.speaker: Ms. Iacolucci
discussion.statement: asked if this amount is given for other events

discussion.speaker: Mayor Rossi
discussion.statement: explained this was allocated, we are just reimbursing volunteers who fronted the money

votes.motion_description: Vouchers be audited, and the meeting adjourned

mayor_announcements.speaker: Mayor Rossi
mayor_announcements.announcement: 8 of 10 "Your Speed Is" signs have been placed around the Village. The data is being monitored, and we will start doing enforcement zones.

mayor_announcements.speaker: Mayor Rossi
mayor_announcements.announcement: Swimming Under the Stars was fantastic. Thank you to Village Pool staff and all of the volunteers.

mayor_announcements.speaker: Mayor Rossi
mayor_announcements.announcement: The Balmuth's have donated a chalice from the Spanish-American War dating back to 1898. Per their wishes, the chalice will be housed in the Library.

liaison_reports.report: reported that the Peach Fest was a big success, and the concert series continues.

announced that the Library will have a ribbon cutting on 8/23 at 2:00pm. The adult book club will begin on 8/14 at 6:30pm, noted Trustee Price-Bush. Trustee Price-Bush also noted that the Annual Senior Picnic will be held on 9/5 at the Saratoga County Fair Grounds and Family Fun Day is 8/17.

noted the Sketch and Print Classes begin 8/31, register through Brookside or the Committee on the Arts Facebook page. Anyone interested in helping clean up Kelley Park should contact the Park and Tree Board through their Facebook page.
